Articles.Content:
Hi,

Iâ€™m happy to announce that the 0.12 Update of KSP is now officially released!

This update marks a big milestone on KSP development. It reaches the goal we set upon ourselves several months ago, to give the Kerbal planet a moon, and to make it possible to land on it.

This update features:

* A Moon (Mun) around Kerbin.

* Planets and Moons rotate, and Kerbin now has a night/day cycle.

* Planets and Moons are now in orbit.

* Itâ€™s possible to send a spacecraft into an orbit around the Sun.

* Thrust Vectoring Liquid Engines.

* And some other stuff.

The full changelog can be seen here.

Cheers!
It will blow your mind up to the MUN!! 8)
Yay! I still remember when there were two items in the project and release section, and I had to keep checking everyday for new mods, now look at this community! I should really start posting more
Hey Harv! The button still says 0.11. Until you put the mouse over it.

Hey Harv! The button still says 0.11. Until you put the mouse over it.

I changed the button when we uploaded the new release... if you are using Chrome, you have to flush your cache, because for some reason it keeps that button.

Cheers

No I\'m not. I\'m using Firefox.

Ah ok. Well in that case, close it and open it again. I checked using Chorme, Firefox and IE and the buttons look ok

Cheers

Yay! I still remember when there were two items in the project and release section, and I had to keep checking everyday for new mods, now look at this community! I should really start posting more

Welcome to the forums!

Happy launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Luigi
Can someone mirror this for me? I\'m having issues downloading!
'Buckle up, Kermans. The time has come...'

Twinky, you know damn well better than to bump an old thread like this. Do not do it again.

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
